intro: Carpotroche subintegra, commonly known as the broad-leaved carpotroche, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its large, broad leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
